primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from human failure and the 'filthy rags' of self-righteousness to the reception of an external righteousness provided by God through the 'Righteous Branch'.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will cause a righteous Branch to spring forth
God has done and will do what his people cannot do for themselves
Thou hast delivered us into the hand of our iniquities
to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ
The time has come for judgment to begin
I will fulfil the promise I made
Judah will be saved and Jerusalem will dwell securely
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver (the one who is 'beastly' or 'unclean' yet forgiven).

tekstueel_bewijs: a righteous Branch to spring forth for David
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who sends the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the life-giving power in the 'Branch'.

tekstueel_bewijs: Sin and Death, those twin Powers, continue to do their annihilating work
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'annihilating' ontological powers that render human effort 'filthy rags'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the community (e.g., rebuilding the burned church) as a sign of God's reign.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The people (white people of Massachusetts/the church)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly a consequence of the first; deeds are 'signs', not the means of righteousness.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God (Promiser) → Righteousness → The Household of God
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Righteous Branch → God ← Sin and Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has not destined us for wrath
God has done and will do what his people cannot do
I will cause a righteous Branch to spring forth
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have all become like one who is unclean
the heathen... have attained righteousness through faith

voorbeelden: we are summoned... to come before his judgment seat
sought to establish its own righteousness
we acknowledge that there is no one that calls upon thy name
we cannot make things turn out right to save our lives
God has done... what his people cannot do

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human LACK of power (non-pouvoir) and God's sovereign endowment of power/righteousness.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Judgment), exposes ~S1 (the failure of self-righteousness), and moves to S1 (The Lord as Righteousness) via ~S2 (Pardon).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Righteous Branch' which executes justice (S2) while providing salvation (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'filthy rags' metaphor is used to strip away all human merit.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It systematically deconstructs human agency as a source of salvation and identifies God as the sole Subject of the rescue operation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: white people... will now step forward and help

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord is our righteousness! Do you see? Our own righteousness... is so corrupted... we cannot make things turn out right.
Sin and Death, those twin Powers, continue to do their annihilating work.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Isaiah, Jeremiah, Paul) are used as witnesses to the human condition or God's promise, not as moral models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God saves like He promised through Jeremiah.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and humility; the 'pressure' to be the hero is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God works, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'filthy rags' of the law to the 'righteousness of God' is logically and narratively seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord is our righteousness... not weighing our merits, but pardoning our offenses.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is mentioned in the 'Spirit-filled' church critique, but the sermon's focus is more Christological/Paternal.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity of 'righteous deeds'; sin infects even the good we do.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The balance is appropriate for an Advent/Judgment context.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Maintain the focus on God's Pouvoir.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God provides righteousness) → Ethics (Deeds as signs).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics, avoiding the trap of turning the 'righteous deeds' of the congregation into a new law.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'filthy rags' imagery, Greimas reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the transfer of the Object (Righteousness) from Sender (God) to Receiver (Man).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 64; Greimas shows how the preacher uses Isaiah 64 to re-map the hearer's identity from 'Subject-Hero' to 'Helpless-Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'NGO' and 'Missionary' examples serve as 'Opponents' to the Subject's desire for self-justification.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' perfectly.
